thread.title: 7 things to know about today, plus best states for wine lovers — tax-wise, that is
thread.title_full: 7 things to know about today, plus best states for wine lovers — tax-wise, that is

author: Cindy Barth
title: 7 things to know about today, plus best states for wine lovers — tax-wise, that is
text: See All Homes of the Day Louisiana has the lowest tax rate, at 11 cents per gallon, followed by California, Texas and Wisconsin. Kentucky has the highest, at $3.18 per gallon, followed by Alaska, Florida and Iowa. Regionally, the South is the least wine-friendly, averaging $1.23 per gallon. The Northeast is the friendliest, averaging $.71 per gallon. And be sure to check out these other Thursday headlines: Skyplex coaster clears FAA hurdle Developer Joshua Wallack can breathe a little easier now that plans for Skyplex's roller coaster structure have been OK'd by the Federal Aviation Administration as posing no hazard to air traffic, the Orlando Sentinel reports. The FAA did note that the structure will be put on aeronautical charts. Read more here . The $460 million-plus Skyplex entertainment complex slated for International Drive includes a 500-foot-plus polercoaster, a drop tower, a zipline, a massive retail promenade, a 350-room hotel and more. Florida HMO profits plunge 90 percent in 2014 HMOs in the Sunshine State collectively reported a huge decrease in net income in 2014 compared to 2013, according to a report from the Florida Office of Insurance Regulation . The 34 HMOs reported a net income of approximately $67 million in 2014, about 10 percent of the $648 million in net income reported in 2013. UnitedHealthCare of Florida reported the biggest loss in 2014: $165 million. That’s $100 million more than the HMO's 2013 loss of $40 million. Humana Medical Plan reported the biggest profit in 2014 at approximately $333 million. But that's still down from the almost $349 million profit it reported in 2013. Read more here . HDR's Kefauver promoted to area manager Congratulations to Christine Kefauver of HDR’s Orlando office, who has been promoted to area manager for Florida, Alabama and Mississippi. She joined HDR last year as managing principal in the Orlando office and will continue in that role. Kefauver has 25 years of transportation planning and policy experience in the public and private arena. Prior to joining HDR, she served as the transportation policy adviser for Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer. She also works closely with the Florida Department of Transportation and local and state agencies. Justice Department investigating airlines for price collusion The U.S. Department of Justice is investigating major U.S. airlines for price collusion and keeping airfares high, The Associated Press reports . According to the report, the department sent a letter to major U.S. carriers demanding copies of all communications between the airlines, Wall Street analysts and major shareholders about their capacity. The Justice Department did not confirm which airlines were being investigated. Four airlines — American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Southwest Airlines and United Airlines ­— still stand after bankruptcies and mergers and now fly more than 80 percent of all domestic passengers.
